channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15643] Need metrics of cache hit ratio, etc for one table
item.description:
There are many tables on our cluster, only some of them need to be read online.

We could improve the performance of read by cache, but we need some metrics for it at table level. There are a few we can collect: BlockCacheCount, BlockCacheSize, BlockCacheHitCount, BlockCacheMissCount, BlockCacheHitPercent
item.summary: Need metrics of cache hit ratio, etc for one table

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Uploaded a patch for collection table level metrics for block cache: BlockCacheCount, BlockCacheSize, BlockCacheHitCount, BlockCacheMissCount, BlockCacheHitPercent

Thanks Alicia Ying Shu for take it up. Let me take a look.
Could you upload it to review board?
Heng Chen Here is the link to review board. Thanks! https://reviews.apache.org/r/49932/
There were some code refactors in master branch after my last patch. Rebased on master and uploaded the patch
-1 No map lookups in the hot code paths.

Elliott Clark Thanks for reviewing. We passed down TableName along the calls so that we can use it as a key when collecting blockCache metrics into a map in CacheStats.java. What other places you would like a map? Thanks.

This message was automatically generated.

LruBlockCache 


 stats.incrementBlockCountForTable(cacheKey.getTableName());

366	    stats.incrementBlockSizeForTable(cacheKey.getTableName(), cb.heapSize());

L1/L2 cache look up and read is in hot path and there adding code like above which involve a Map lookup operation will be perf hit. That is what the comment means. Agree with it. We should be careful abt doing this.

incrementHitForTable does 


MetricsTableCacheValues val = tableCacheMetricsMap.get(tableName);

incrementHitForTable/incrementMissForTable is called on every block read.

Agreed. Alicia Ying Shu did some experiments with ycsb loading, and there was a perf hit about 3% of so. We were discussing offline about a way to carry the metrics reference in the HRegion itself where it is initialized once per region lifecycle, and pass it down to the HFileBlockKey to get rid of the map lookup. I think she will prototype the approach to see whether it works or not.

Elliott Clark Anoop Sam John Thanks for the comments. As mentioned by Enis Soztutar I did some perf testing using YCSB. The perf penalty was about 3%. I attached the excel sheet here. Will prototype the idea of carrying metric reference in HRegion opening and passing it down.
